title: THIS Is Why You Might Want A 5G Router - Razer Sila Preview
description: The Razer Sila router and Kishi controller are the start of a much larger 5G ecosystem that Razer is building for both PC and mobile gaming.  Its a pretty interesting concept.    Subscribe    As an Amazon Associate we earn from qualifying purchases.   Gear list (Available on Amazon):  Main Camera (Dmitry) -  Main Lens (Dmitry) -  Main Camera (Eber) -  Main Lens (Eber) -  Main 2nd Lens (Eber) -  Main Camera Mic (D & E) -  Cheap 4K Camera (Panasonic G7) -  Awesome Slider -  Our Shotgun Mic -  ------------------------------------------------------------ Our full site:  Join Our Forums:   Follow us for more updates! Twitter  FaceBook  Instagram  -------------------------------------------------------  #razersila #razerkishi #5grouter #wifi6 #ces2020 #hardwarecanucks
transcript: hello good people I'm Dimitri and mobile gaming it's probably something that none of us or probably many of us don't want to talk about but I think we have to face the reality it is to me but I think I get what Razer is trying to do since 5g connections technically can achieve a hundred gigabytes per second speeds which are faster than most landline connections you could take latency fast connection and no reliability on something that we can't really control that of course means we have no data caps but I guess we can dream maybe the future that would be the reality now since this whole thing is still in prototype phases there's not really much talk about the exterior other than it looks like a UE boom speaker with a few razor touches it's black with a bit of green on the globe and around back there's a USB 3.0 port in case you want to plug in external storage drives three LAN ports and a single when input there's also an internal SIM card slot that will probably move somewhere closer to the back for easier access that means it can either be used in Wired mode as a standard home router or be used with the sim card and 4G or 5g s down the line razors next step towards rounding out this whole mobile gaming ecosystem is what they call Razer Kishi or as we with the guys like to call Razer kimchee my god these names so this thing is a mobile controller that clips onto pretty much any iPhone or Android phone provided it has a USB C or Apple lightning connector unfortunately it sounds like there are two separate devices for Android and iOS instead of being able to replace the actual cable why but basically razer took all their learnings from Razer's phone to jungle cat controller to create this thing and from our short time with it the kishi or the kimchi actually feels pretty awesome the triggers are well placed and they have excellent feedback and even with bigger phones installed the whole thing never felt too bulky it's also really well contoured for a huge range of hand sizes and both mic and even prefer the Kishi controller over the Nvidia controller and even over the ps4 controller I did find forward and back buttons to be awkwardly placed but other than that it's a pretty good handheld experience to install a smart phone all you have to do is stretch open the grips secure them into place and most controller enabled games should recognize it it offers pasture charging - even though there isn't an incorporated battery and since it's a wired connection latency should be pretty much eliminated now personally I'm not a family trollers I'm over keyboard and mouse type of guy and I never play on mobile devices but with official support with GeForce now and cloud X you could potentially get away playing some
